result.execSummary:
The defendant Kellea J Cross Koterman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 3 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is to be paid within 30 DAYS to Kwik Trip and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AMENDED 06-01-2016:  Court waives DNA surcharge.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim (T. T.) or his residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Letter dated May 26, 2016 filed by defendant, requesting the DNA surcharge cost be removed from her sentence.
Court's response letter to defendant denying defendant's request; DNA surcharge to remain as part of costs.
dated 5/3/16 filed by defendant requesting waiver for DNA surcharge, with attachment.

filed by defendant requesting the DNA requirement and surcharge be removed from this sentence.

12/22/15 - Left voice for defendant advising her that Court denies request to remove DNA sample requirement and surcharge. Defendant is required to provide a DNA sample as a result of a statutory change ealier this year. The statute requires providing a sample even if one had been previously provided.

records.addlTxt:
Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kellea J Cross Koterman in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim presented a statement to the court.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.




Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years
3 Days Credit.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probtion:  18 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant not to possess anyone else financial information.
Absolute Sobriety.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  the Victim (T.T) or his residence listed in the Complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.


RESTITUTION:  $209.96 (to be paid to Kwik Trip - restitution to be paid before costs or fines); - to be paid within 30 Days.
Costs: $268
DNA Sample and Surcharges:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.  


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
